trigger.name: Temperature of batteries above 25ÂºC
trigger.description: All batteries have a rated capacity which is determined based on specified conditions. The rated capacity of a UPS battery is based on an ambient temperature of 25Â°C (77Â°F). Operating the UPS under these conditions will maximize the life of the UPS and result in optimal performance. While a UPS will continue to operate in varying temperatures, it is important to note that this will likely result in diminishing the performance and lifespan of your battery. A general rule to remember is that for every 8.3Â°C (15Â°F) above the ambient temperature of 25Â°C (77Â°F), the life of the battery will be reduced by 50 percent. Therefore, keeping a UPS at a comfortable temperature is crucial to maximizing UPS life and capabilities.

trigger.name: Temperature of batteries below 19ÂºC
trigger.description: Under 19Âº battery capacity will get reduced although life will be extended
